20101230161223.000|20101230161226.000|TR0|here.  Can you tell us why this is 
20101230161226.000|20101230161229.000|TR0|happening now?
20101230161229.000|20101230161231.000|TR0|
20101230161231.000|20101230161234.000|TR0|MOLLY PARKER, "THE CLARION-LEDGER":  Well, 
20101230161234.000|20101230161237.000|TR0|they have been in prison for 16 years.  
20101230161237.000|20101230161239.000|TR0|Their mother and other activists, largely 
20101230161239.000|20101230161242.000|TR0|the black community, has been pushing for 
20101230161242.000|20101230161244.000|TR0|the release for some amount of time.

20101230161350.000|20101230161353.000|TR0|And the women have always maintained their

20101230161355.000|20101230161358.000|TR0|
20101230161358.000|20101230161400.000|TR0|MARTIN SAVIDGE, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Right. 
20101230161400.000|20101230161403.000|TR0| Now, this is a crime that dates back to 
20101230161403.000|20101230161406.000|TR0|1993, and it took place in the middle of 
20101230161406.000|20101230161408.000|TR0|the state of Mississippi.
20101230161408.000|20101230161411.000|TR0|
20101230161411.000|20101230161414.000|TR0|And allegedly, what happened here was that 
20101230161414.000|20101230161416.000|TR0|these two women were accused of luring 
20101230161416.000|20101230161419.000|TR0|several other men into what was described 
20101230161419.000|20101230161421.000|TR0|as an ambush, an ambush in which the men 
20101230161421.000|20101230161424.000|TR0|were beaten with a shotgun and then robbed 
20101230161424.000|20101230161427.000|TR0|of the $11.  The young women came to try 
20101230161427.000|20101230161429.000|TR0|and they essentially pleaded not guilty to 
20101230161429.000|20101230161432.000|TR0|being accessories, but they were convicted 
20101230161432.000|20101230161435.000|TR0|of actually being -- or accused and 
20101230161435.000|20101230161437.000|TR0|convicted of armed robbery, and they both 
20101230161437.000|20101230161440.000|TR0|got life sentences as a result of that.
20101230161440.000|20101230161442.000|TR0|

20101230164402.000|20101230164405.000|TR0|You hear the term user friendly a lot when

20101230164415.000|20101230164418.000|TR0|
20101230164418.000|20101230164421.000|TR0|Dan Simon reports.
20101230164421.000|20101230164423.000|TR0|
20101230164423.000|20101230164426.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101230164426.000|20101230164428.000|TR0|
20101230164428.000|20101230164431.000|TR0|DAN SIMON, CNN CORRESPONDENT (on camera):  
20101230164431.000|20101230164434.000|TR0|We are outside the apple stores in 
20101230164434.000|20101230164436.000|TR0|downtown San Francisco, a place that is 
20101230164436.000|20101230164439.000|TR0|always busy. It appears that Apple's 
20101230164439.000|20101230164442.000|TR0|retail division had a phenomenal 
20101230164442.000|20101230164444.000|TR0|Christmas. But now they're getting 
20101230164444.000|20101230164447.000|TR0|unwanted attention in the form of a 
20101230164447.000|20101230164449.000|TR0|lawsuit.
20101230164449.000|20101230164452.000|TR0|
20101230164452.000|20101230164455.000|TR0|This lawsuit filed by a man in Los Angeles 
20101230164455.000|20101230164457.000|TR0|alleges that Apple and some popular app 
20101230164457.000|20101230164500.000|TR0|developers, are selling some private user 
20101230164500.000|20101230164503.000|TR0|information to advertisers without the 
20101230164503.000|20101230164505.000|TR0|consent of people who own their devices 
20101230164505.000|20101230164508.000|TR0|like iPhones and iPads.
20101230164508.000|20101230164510.000|TR0|
20101230164510.000|20101230164513.000|TR0|(voice-over):  The complaint alleges that 
20101230164513.000|20101230164516.000|TR0|in some cases, Apple and the app makers 
20101230164516.000|20101230164518.000|TR0|are selling personal data, including age, 
20101230164518.000|20101230164521.000|TR0|gender and the locate of people using the 
20101230164521.000|20101230164524.000|TR0|devices.  The lawsuit notes that iPhones 
20101230164524.000|20101230164526.000|TR0|and iPads contain what is called, the 
20101230164526.000|20101230164529.000|TR0|unique device identifier, or UDID.
20101230164529.000|20101230164531.000|TR0|
20101230164531.000|20101230164534.000|TR0|The UDID helps advertisers track what 
20101230164534.000|20101230164537.000|TR0|applications user download, how frequently 
20101230164537.000|20101230164539.000|TR0|they're used, and for how long.  Users 
20101230164539.000|20101230164542.000|TR0|cannot block the transmission of the UDID, 
20101230164542.000|20101230164545.000|TR0|which is a long character that uniquely 
20101230164545.000|20101230164547.000|TR0|identifies each device.
20101230164547.000|20101230164550.000|TR0|
20101230164550.000|20101230164552.000|TR0|(on camera):  Now, it is not alleged that 
20101230164552.000|20101230164555.000|TR0|advertisers are getting anything beyond 
20101230164555.000|20101230164558.000|TR0|general information, such as names.  But, 
20101230164558.000|20101230164600.000|TR0|we asked people out here how they would 
20101230164600.000|20101230164603.000|TR0|feel about some of their personal data 
20101230164603.000|20101230164605.000|TR0|unknowingly going to advertisers.
20101230164605.000|20101230164608.000|TR0|
20101230164608.000|20101230164611.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  I don't have a 
20101230164611.000|20101230164613.000|TR0|problem with because I think they're not 
20101230164613.000|20101230164616.000|TR0|-- I especially like the kind where you 
20101230164616.000|20101230164619.000|TR0|can click and it says, no, we're not going 
20101230164619.000|20101230164621.000|TR0|to send you stuff or sell you stuff when 
20101230164621.000|20101230164624.000|TR0|you do those type of things.  So I feel 
20101230164624.000|20101230164626.000|TR0|pretty comfortable with that.  And I feel

20101230164954.000|20101230164956.000|TR0|The Tournament of Roses was first held in 
20101230164956.000|20101230164959.000|TR0|Pasadena to lure freezing vacationers west 
20101230164959.000|20101230165002.000|TR0|to thaw out.  Pasadena, the town where 
20101230165002.000|20101230165004.000|TR0|flowers bloom all year long.  What year 
20101230165004.000|20101230165007.000|TR0|was the very first Rose Parade held?  Was 
20101230165007.000|20101230165009.000|TR0|it 1890, 1913 or 1920?

20101230165023.000|20101230165025.000|TR0|enjoyed relaxing on the couch and watching
